item.title: Broke Millennial
item.dc:creator: root
item.description:
1. Book Name: Broke Millennial

  2. Description: Slay your money woes like a financial ninja! This relatable guide helps young adults navigate budgeting, debt, and building financial stability.

  3. Author Name: Erin Lowry

  4. Tags: Personal finance, Budgeting, Young adults, Self-improvement
item.content:encoded: Slay your money woes like a financial ninja! This relatable guide helps young adults navigate budgeting, debt, and building financial stability.

item.title: I Will Teach You to Be Rich
item.dc:creator: root
item.description: Ditch the financial jargon and build wealth like a boss with actionable tips on budgeting, investing, and achieving financial freedom.
item.content:encoded:
1. Book Name: I Will Teach You to Be Rich

  2. Description: Ditch the financial jargon and build wealth like a boss with actionable tips on budgeting, investing, and achieving financial freedom.

  3. Author Name: Ramit Sethi

  4. Category: Non-fiction

  5. Tags: Financial literacy, Investing, Self-improvement, Young adults

item.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
item.dc:creator: root
item.description:
1. Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter
  2. Price: Around $16.95 USD, but may vary depending on edition and retailer
  3. Genre: Non-fiction, Personal Finance
  4. Category: Self-help, Business Education
  5. Pages: 336 pages (272 pages in the original 1997 edition)
  6. Publisher: Plata Publishing (previously Plata Publishing LLC)
  7. Publication Date: April 8, 1997
item.content:encoded:
“Rich Dad Poor Dad” is a personal finance book published in 1997 by Robert Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It has become a global phenomenon, selling over 32 million copies and translated into over 51 languages. Here’s a summary of what the book is about:

Central theme: Through the contrasting perspectives of Kiyosaki’s real father (“poor dad”) and his friend’s father (“rich dad”), the book challenges conventional ideas about money and encourages financial independence.
